value:
If we're stealing from the rich to give
to the poor, then count me in.

Beast tribe laguz tend to be quiet and
agile. Lots of them could be great
thieves, if they chose to.

Someday, I hope we live in a world
where stealing is unnecessary. And
unheard of.

These clothes are as comfortable as
they are functional. I'm tempted to
just wear them all the time.

If you need a lock handled, let me
know. I've been picking them for
most of my life.

I'm Sothe. Here for the festivities, on
$Nf's orders.

Slow. Too slow. I'm falling asleep
over here.

No sweat. I could have handled this
even without my thieving skills.
Guess I got careless...
For me? Don't mind if I do.

I'm Sothe, of the Dawn Brigade.
I don't know too much about what's
going on here, but I'd like to help out.

I saw some children messing around
in the square earlier. Playing at
being thieves.$k$pTheir game was all about stealing the
silver and gold from the villains and
giving it over to the needy.$k$pIt's amazing to me that we all know
stealing is wrong, but at the same
time, that feels like justice.$k$pI think we can all agree that what we
really want is a world where no one
has to steal to survive or be happy.$k$pIn a world like that, thieves would
only exist in celebrations like this one.$k$pBut speaking ofâ€”the party's still on,
right? Let's keep it going a bit longer.
I want Micaiah to have some fun too.
What's yours is mine.
You brought this on yourself.
I'll get the goods.
Surprise.
I messed up...
Taking to give to folks in need isn't theft. It's doing the right thing.
You again? Don't you ever get bored of doing that?
I'm not after anything in particular, but I would like to nab something for Micaiah.
Most nobles get rich by trampling on commoners. I'll take whatever I can from them.
All dressed up in black. Should help me blend in to the shadows as I go about my business.
Our goal's to make the world a place where nobody has to steal to survive.
You should learn how to pick a lock. Never know when that could come in handy.
Yeah.
Make up your mind.
It's mine now.
